translated: Boström, Einar Charles Severin, telegraph officer, born on November 5, 1900 in Ausås, Kristianstad county, son of Alfred B. and Ester Jönsson. He was a telegraph trainee in Hälsingborg in 1918, acted as a temporary telegraph assistant in Stockholm in 1919, became a regular telegraph assistant in 1925, the first telegraph assistant at the distribution office in Gävle in 1936, a grade 3 telegraph official in Västervik in 1939, and a grade 2 telegraph official there in 1945. He traveled to Germany, England, and France on a few occasions and was a member of the Swedish scouting council and the Pistolette Shooting Club. He married, but the name of his partner is not given in the abbreviated biography.

workExperience.name: Gävle
workExperience.title: First Telegraph Assistant at the Distribution Office
